an5.114:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Magadhans at Andhakavinda.
an5.114:1.2: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:
an5.114:2.1: “Ānanda, those bhikkhus who are junior, recently gone forth, newly come to this teaching-and-discipline should be encouraged, supported, and established in five things.
an5.114:2.3: They should be encouraged, supported, and established in restraint in the monastic code: ‘Friends, please be virtuous. Live restrained in the monastic code, conducting yourselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, keep the rules you’ve undertaken.’
an5.114:3.1: They should be encouraged, supported, and established in sense restraint: ‘Friends, please live with sense doors guarded, remembering to be judicious and on guard, with a mind guarded by recollection.’
an5.114:4.1: They should be encouraged, supported, and established in limiting their speech: ‘Friends, please speak little. Put a limit on your speech.’
an5.114:5.1: They should be encouraged, supported, and established in seclusion: ‘Friends, please be forest-dwellers. Frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.’
an5.114:6.1: They should be encouraged, supported, and established in right perspective: ‘Friends, please have right view and right perspective.’
an5.114:6.2: Those bhikkhus who are junior, recently gone forth, newly come to this teaching-and-discipline should be encouraged, supported, and established in these five things.”
